Address.university_name: Université Paris-Panthéon-Assas – Institut de Management et de Communication interculturels

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1957, ISIT Paris is a non-profit higher education institution which grants government-accredited master’s degrees. Graduates pursue a wide range of careers all over the world in the marketing, communications, human resources, sales and purchasing departments of international companies, and as translators, conference interpreters and lawyer-linguists for international organizations including the European Union, NATO, the OECD and the United Nations. ISIT has signed collaborative agreements with high performing schools and universities both in France and abroad.Became in 2015 "Etablissement d'enseignement supérieur prive d'intérêt général (EESPIG)". In 2022, ISIT becomes a component institution of Paris-Panthéon-Assas University
AdmissionRequirements: High school degree (Baccalauréat, all sections) or equivalent and entrance examination
Prerequisite : students must be fluent or have an excellent understanding in French and English

Divisions.Details: In the global context of contemporary politics and world economics, there is a need for high-level multilingual communication. ISIT's Master in Conference Interpreting  meets international organizations' demands.

At the end of the Master's course, our graduates know how to translate in an intercultural and multidisciplinary environment and have consolidated their expertise in digital multilingual communication.
At the end of the program, our students know how to innovate in a multilingual web environment, have reinforced their multimedia creativity as well as their project management skills.
At the end of their Master's course, students will have developed their international agility; know how to manage in an intercultural environment and have become experts in project management.
At the end of the graduate course, students will be able to interact in a multilingual geopolitical environment and have become experts in project management in a multilateral context.
Our Lawyer-Linguist program is organized in partnership with leading law schools (double degree). ISIT provides language and intercultural training as students complete a law degree in parallel

Address.university_name: (EDL)

GeneralInformation.History: The Ecole du Louvre is a school of higher education placed under the authority of the ministry of Culture. The Ecole du Louvre has been training museum and cultural heritage professionals since 1882 (Modified Décree n°2015-1065 of August 26, 2015). Housed at the heart of the Palace of the Louvre and closely connected to the greatest museum in the world, the Ecole du Louvre welcomes and trains around 1600 students. Its history-filled premises form a 6000 square-meter « campus » which has been fully renovated and equipped with the latest technical equipment.The Ecole du Louvre offers an original and unique curriculum, at the heart of Paris’ heritage and in close collaboration with its museums

Address.university_name: Ecole nationale supérieure des sciences de l'information et des bibliothèques

GeneralInformation.History:
Enssib is a public scientific, cultural and professional institution, governed by decree n° 92-25 of 9 January 1992. It is both a "grande école", responsible for training state library managers, curators and librarians, recruited by competitive examination, and a specialised university institution, awarding the master's degree and two institutional diplomas. The School also offers a wide range of lifelong training courses, both on site and by distance learning, as well as validation of prior learning and accredited courses.
Heir to the École nationale supérieure des bibliothécaires created in 1963, Enssib has developed over the years an original training offer, at the crossroads of the professional world and academic research, which today makes it the French reference institution in the field of information science, librarianship and digital information management.
Within the framework of the 2016-2020 five-year site contract, Enssib is accredited for four master's degrees. It hosts two research teams, Elico and the Centre Gabriel Naudé. Through its websites and its digital library, it promotes research and the dissemination of resources in information science and the history of books and libraries.The Enssib is a member of the Network of Schools of Public Service and an associate member of the University of Lyon
AdmissionRequirements: Competitive examination

Divisions.College: State and City of Paris librarians

GeneralInformation.History: Established in Paris in 1819, ESCP is the oldest business school in the world and was destined to be European from the outset. In 2023, the school celebrates 50 years of European identity and configuration. Its first overseas campuses date back to 1973. Today, with campuses in Berlin, London, Madrid, Paris, Turin, and Warsaw, ESCP is the only pan-European business school offering a unique and comprehensive vision of Europe within a mature continental multi-campus framework. Since January 2018, the school has operated as a private non-profit institution, with a public shareholder (CCIR) owning the majority of total shares. The Alumni Association and ESCP Foundation are the other two shareholders.

Address.college_name: National Library and Information Sciences School
Address.university_name: École nationale des sciences de l'information et des bibliothèques (ENSSIB)

GeneralInformation.History:
Heir to the École nationale supérieure des bibliothécaires, created in 1963, Enssib is a public institution created by Decree No. 92–25 of 9 January 1992. It operates under the auspices of the French Ministry of Higher Education and Research and is administered by a Board of Directors and a Scientific Council.
Enssib trains managers in information, documentation and library sciences for the public and private sectors, through a combination of initial and continuing education. Enssib also puts great store on research as well as on promoting science and culture, particularly through its publications, its events program and the distribution of its open access resources.
It provides : 
- initial statutory training for civil servants destined for scientific and supervisory functions in libraries (State curators, state librarians, and the city of Paris' Librarians). 
- a lifelong training program in the field of information science and libraries, on site and remotely.
- three master's courses under the heading "Information and Library Sciences" (digital archives; scientific and technical information; library and documentation policy),
- a master's course under the heading "History, civilizations, heritage" (cultures of writing and image)
- a “Practices and methods in Digital Humanities” course under the heading “Digital Humanities”.
It also provides two establishment diplomas, all or part of which are carried out remotely:
- the diploma of operational framework of libraries and documentation and
- the university degree in information and library sciences offered jointly with the Senghor University of Alexandria.
All of these training courses fall within a highly coordinated field of training entitled Data, documents, digital and temporalities.
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: Septembre to January / February to June
AdmissionRequirements: Licence and competitive entrance examination for civil servants preparing the DCB, licence for students preparing the master degree

Divisions.College: Diplôme d'établissement Cadre opérationnel des bibliothèques et de la documentation / Library Manager
Diplôme Universitaire en Sciences de l’Information et des Bibliothèques (DUSIB)
Master 1 - Sciences de l'information et des bibliothèques (Panist) / Library and Information Science
Culture de l'Ecrit et de l'Image / Cultural Heritage
